policies.title: AB 2885 - AI Literacy Act
policies.description: Requires the California Department of Education to develop a model AI literacy curriculum for K-12 schools.
policies.summary_text: Directs CDE to develop model AI literacy guidelines and resources for incorporation into math, science, and computer science curriculum frameworks. Requires consideration of AI ethics, bias, and societal impact.

policies.title: Executive Order N-12-23 on AI
policies.description: Governor Newsom's executive order establishing California's approach to AI, including education provisions.
policies.summary_text: Directs state agencies to study AI risks and benefits. Includes provisions for workforce development and education system preparedness for AI integration.

policies.title: SB 1288 - Public Schools AI Working Group
policies.description: Establishes an AI working group to develop guidance and model policy for safe, equitable AI use in California public schools.
policies.summary_text: Directs the Superintendent of Public Instruction to convene a working group, with at least half being current classroom teachers, to develop guidance on safe AI use in schools by January 2026 and a model policy by July 2026.

policies.title: HB 2985 - AI in Education Study
policies.description: Directs the Oregon Department of Education to study the use of AI in schools and report findings.
policies.summary_text: Requires ODE to convene a work group to study AI use in education, examine impacts on students and teachers, and deliver recommendations to the legislature.

policies.title: HB 2094 - AI Literacy Education
policies.description: Requires AI literacy concepts to be integrated into Virginia's computer science standards of learning.
policies.summary_text: Mandates the Board of Education to incorporate AI literacy into computer science standards, including understanding AI capabilities, limitations, ethical considerations, and societal impact.

policies.title: SB 5693 - AI Task Force
policies.description: Establishes a task force on AI in Washington state government, including education applications.
policies.summary_text: Creates an AI task force to examine AI use across state agencies including education. Requires recommendations on responsible AI adoption, workforce impacts, and student data protection.

policies.title: SB 812 - AI in Education Task Force
policies.description: Creates a legislative study commission on AI use in public schools.
policies.summary_text: Establishes the Joint Legislative Study Commission on AI in Public Schools to study current and potential use of AI, examine impacts on teaching and learning, and recommend legislation.

policies.title: PA 24-151 - AI in Education Working Group
policies.description: Establishes a working group to study and make recommendations regarding AI in education.
policies.summary_text: Creates an AI in Education Working Group under the State Department of Education to study AI impacts on K-12 education and develop recommendations for responsible AI integration.

policies.title: A8195 - AI in Education Study Bill
policies.description: Directs the commissioner of education to study AI use in schools.
policies.summary_text: Directs the commissioner of education to conduct a study on the use of AI in elementary and secondary education, examining both opportunities and risks.

policies.title: HB 3261 - AI Advisory Council
policies.description: Creates a state AI advisory council with education sector representation.
policies.summary_text: Establishes the AI Advisory Council to study and monitor AI systems used by state agencies. Includes education representatives and examines AI impacts on the education workforce.

policies.title: HB 3563 - Generative AI and Natural Language Processing Task Force (PA 103-0451)
policies.description: Creates a task force to study generative AI and natural language processing technologies, including impacts on education.
policies.summary_text: Enacted as Public Act 103-0451. Creates the Generative AI and Natural Language Processing Task Force to study impacts of generative AI technologies on various sectors including education, workforce, and the economy. The task force provides recommendations to the General Assembly.

policies.title: HB 3851 - AI Deepfake Cyberbullying in Schools
policies.description: Expands the definition of cyberbullying to include AI-generated deepfake content shared without consent.
policies.summary_text: Amends the School Code to expand the definition of cyberbullying to include posting or sharing a person's AI-generated digital replica online without permission if it causes harm. Takes effect for the 2026-2027 school year.

policies.title: HB 24-1468 - AI Transparency in Education
policies.description: Requires transparency when AI systems are used in educational decisions.
policies.summary_text: Requires educational institutions to disclose when AI systems are used in consequential decisions affecting students. Establishes transparency and notification requirements.

policies.title: AI Literacy Act of 2024
policies.description: Federal bill to promote AI literacy in K-12 education nationwide.
policies.summary_text: Establishes a grant program through the Department of Education to support AI literacy education in K-12 schools. Funds curriculum development, teacher training, and research.

policies.title: AI in Education Act of 2023
policies.description: Federal bill to study AI impacts on education and create recommendations.
policies.summary_text: Directs the Department of Education to conduct a comprehensive study on AI in education, develop recommendations for responsible AI use, and create resources for educators.

policies.title: CREATE AI Act of 2023
policies.description: Federal bill to establish AI education and workforce development programs.
policies.summary_text: Creates competitive grant programs for AI education, including K-12 AI literacy, teacher training, and higher education AI programs. Focuses on equitable access.

policies.title: Executive Order 14110 on Safe AI (Revoked)
policies.description: President Biden's executive order on AI safety, including education provisions. Revoked by President Trump on January 20, 2025.
policies.summary_text: Comprehensive executive order on AI safety and security. Included directives for the Department of Education to develop resources for AI-enabled education, create guidelines for AI use in schools, and address equity concerns. Revoked by Executive Order 14148 on January 20, 2025.

policies.title: Executive Order on Advancing AI Education for American Youth
policies.description: President Trump's executive order to integrate AI education into K-12 classrooms nationwide.
policies.summary_text: Promotes AI literacy by integrating AI into K-12 education, providing comprehensive AI training for educators, and fostering early exposure to AI concepts. Establishes White House Task Force on AI Education and Presidential AI Challenge for youth.

policies.title: S3876 - AI Instruction in Schools
policies.description: Requires school districts to provide instruction on AI and requires the Secretary of Higher Education to develop AI model curricula.
policies.summary_text: Required school districts to incorporate AI instruction in grades K-12 as part of the NJ Student Learning Standards in Computer Science and Design Thinking. Also required each public institution of higher education to offer certificate and degree programs in AI. Did not advance before the 2024-2025 session ended.

policies.title: AI Literacy Pilot Program
policies.description: Massachusetts Department of Education AI literacy pilot in select school districts.
policies.summary_text: DESE launched a pilot program in partnership with select districts to develop and test AI literacy curriculum frameworks for grades 6-12.

policies.title: SR 321 - AI in Education Study Committee
policies.description: Creates a Senate study committee on AI in education.
policies.summary_text: Establishes a Senate study committee to examine the use of AI in Georgia's education system, focusing on opportunities, risks, and needed policy frameworks.

policies.title: HB 487 - Computer Science and AI Graduation Requirement
policies.description: Makes computer science including AI concepts a high school graduation requirement in Georgia.
policies.summary_text: Requires a computer science course as a high school graduation requirement beginning in 2031. Course standards include AI concepts, preparing students for technology-driven careers.

policies.title: SB 1227 - AI Education Standards
policies.description: Requires Pennsylvania to develop AI education standards for K-12.
policies.summary_text: Directs the Department of Education to develop and implement AI education standards for K-12 schools, including AI literacy, computational thinking, and ethical AI use.

policies.title: AI Guidance for Schools
policies.description: Wisconsin DPI guidance document on AI use in K-12 schools.
policies.summary_text: Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction published comprehensive guidance for schools on responsible AI use, covering academic integrity, teacher tools, and student data privacy.

policies.title: AI in Education Guidance Framework
policies.description: Ohio Department of Education AI guidance for districts and schools.
policies.summary_text: Ohio's Department of Education and Workforce released a framework providing guidance to districts on integrating AI tools, addressing academic integrity, and protecting student data.

policies.title: HB 513 - AI Learning Amendments
policies.description: Requires AI literacy instruction in Utah schools.
policies.summary_text: Amends education code to include AI literacy as part of the digital literacy standards for K-12 students. Requires integration into existing technology and computer science courses.

policies.title: HB 1591 - AI Task Force
policies.description: Creates an AI task force with education sector focus in Indiana.
policies.summary_text: Establishes an AI task force to study the impact of AI across Indiana, with specific attention to education, workforce development, and state agency use of AI tools.

policies.title: HB 1296 - AI in Education
policies.description: Required schools to establish AI inventory processes, adopt AI policies, and prohibited penalizing students solely based on AI detection tool evidence.
policies.summary_text: Required schools to establish a process for teachers and administrators to submit AI platforms for inventory and conduct annual surveys about AI usage. Required schools to adopt and publicly post AI policies. Prohibited schools from penalizing students solely based on AI detection tool evidence. Died in the House Education Committee without advancing.

policies.title: HF 3775 - AI Literacy in Schools
policies.description: Establishes AI literacy requirements in Minnesota's academic standards.
policies.summary_text: Requires the commissioner of education to incorporate AI literacy into Minnesota's academic standards, including understanding AI systems, ethical implications, and practical applications.

policies.title: CS/HB 1361 - Computer Science and AI Education
policies.description: Expands computer science education to include AI concepts.
policies.summary_text: Amends Florida education statutes to include artificial intelligence within computer science education standards. Requires AI concepts to be taught as part of the K-12 computer science curriculum.

policies.title: SB 1711 - AI Policies in Education (Public Chapter 550)
policies.description: Requires all Tennessee school districts, charter schools, and public universities to adopt AI use policies.
policies.summary_text: Requires each local board of education, charter school governing body, and public higher education institution to adopt policies regarding AI technology use by students, teachers, faculty, and staff for instructional and assignment purposes. Tennessee is the only state mandating district-level AI rules.

policies.title: HB 531 - AI Literacy Instruction
policies.description: Requires age-appropriate AI instruction in Tennessee schools and professional development for educators.
policies.summary_text: Requires local education agencies and public charter schools to provide age-appropriate instruction on accessing, utilizing, and critically evaluating AI tools. Requires the Department of Education to issue implementation guidance and provide AI professional development programs.

policies.title: AB 406 - AI in Schools Mental Health Services
policies.description: Prohibits use of AI to replace school counselors, psychologists, and social workers in Nevada public schools.
policies.summary_text: Prohibits the use of AI in public schools for counselors, psychologists, or social workers, except for administrative efficiencies. Requires the Department of Education to develop guidance for mental health professionals on responsible AI use in student services.

policies.title: SB 2426 - AI Task Force
policies.description: Creates the Artificial Intelligence Regulation Task Force to study AI technologies including education applications.
policies.summary_text: Establishes the Artificial Intelligence Regulation (AIR) Task Force with seven voting members including legislative and agency representatives, plus expert ex-officio members from education, healthcare, and technology. Must report findings annually; dissolves December 31, 2027.

policies.title: HB 332 - Computer Science and AI Graduation Requirement
policies.description: Requires completion of a computer science course including AI concepts for high school graduation in Alabama.
policies.summary_text: Beginning with the graduating class of 2031, requires all public school students to earn at least one computer science course credit including AI, coding, and quantum computing for graduation. Passed the Alabama House.

policies.title: HB 1391 - AI in K-12 Education
policies.description: Mandates the Maryland State Department of Education to develop AI guidance and approved AI tools for classrooms.
policies.summary_text: Requires MSDE to develop and update guidance on AI use in education, create a list of approved AI tools for classroom use, and establish a task force to study AI's implications in K-12 education.

policies.title: Executive Order 01.01.2024.02 - AI in State Government
policies.description: Governor Moore's executive order catalyzing responsible and productive AI use in Maryland state government.
policies.summary_text: Establishes framework for responsible AI use across Maryland state agencies including education. Directs agencies to develop AI use policies and identify beneficial AI applications while managing risks.

policies.title: HB 2 - Education Data Governance and AI Working Group
policies.description: Directs creation of an education data governance and AI working group within the legislative education study committee.
policies.summary_text: Directs the legislative education study committee to create an education data governance and AI working group to study and recommend structures for improved statewide education data governance and policies addressing AI in education.

policies.title: Executive Order 24-01 - Artificial Intelligence
policies.description: Washington state executive order establishing AI governance framework including education workforce assessment.
policies.summary_text: Directs assessment of generative AI's impact on the state workforce and identifies research opportunities and partnerships with institutions to power innovation and expansion of AI technology and education.

policies.title: Executive Order 2024-12 - AI Task Force
policies.description: Maine executive order establishing an AI task force to study AI impacts across state functions including education.
policies.summary_text: Creates an AI task force to study AI impacts and develop recommendations for responsible use across state agencies. Led to the Department of Education releasing an AI guidance toolkit in February 2025.

policies.title: Governor's AI Task Force
policies.description: Arkansas governor established an AI task force that released an initial report with education recommendations.
policies.summary_text: Established a task force to comprehensively study AI across state functions. Released initial report with recommendations on risk management, phased policy development, AI literacy curriculum frameworks, and educator professional development.

policies.title: Alaska K12 AI Framework
policies.description: Alaska Department of Education comprehensive guidance on responsible AI integration in K-12 schools.
policies.summary_text: Comprehensive guidance on responsible AI integration in K-12 education, focusing on augmenting human capabilities while maintaining ethical and responsible use practices.

policies.title: Generative AI in the Classroom Guidance
policies.description: Delaware guidance on understanding, implementing, and integrating generative AI in K-12 classrooms.
policies.summary_text: Provides guidance on understanding AI, classroom implementation, and professional learning. Published by the Delaware Council on Educational Technology to support educators in integrating generative AI responsibly.

policies.title: AI Guidance for Education
policies.description: Hawaii Department of Education guidance on ethical and responsible AI use in schools.
policies.summary_text: Establishes a balanced approach to AI in education with emphasis on ethical considerations and a framework for responsible use by students and educators across Hawaii's public schools.

policies.title: AI Guidance for Education
policies.description: Kentucky Department of Education AI guidance promoting consistency in technology integration.
policies.summary_text: Provides guidance on consistent technology integration with a balanced approach to AI in education. Promotes normalization of responsible AI use across Kentucky schools.

policies.title: Comprehensive AI Guide for K-12 Schools
policies.description: Louisiana Department of Education comprehensive AI guidance covering classroom integration and safeguards.
policies.summary_text: Comprehensive guide covering AI overview, challenges, plagiarism and cheating mitigation strategies, classroom integration approaches, and safeguards for student data. Published following the state AI Task Force recommendations.

policies.title: AI Guidance for Education
policies.description: Missouri Department of Education AI guidance covering capabilities, professional development, and data privacy.
policies.summary_text: Covers AI capabilities and limitations, professional development recommendations, instructional practices, and data privacy considerations for Missouri schools.

policies.title: Montana AI in K12 Education Guidelines
policies.description: Montana Department of Education human-centered approach guidelines for AI in K-12 education.
policies.summary_text: Establishes a human-centered approach to AI in education with core principles addressing benefits, risks, professional learning needs, and accessibility considerations.

policies.title: K-12 AI Guidance Framework
policies.description: North Dakota guidance framework for AI policy development in K-12 schools.
policies.summary_text: Provides a framework to guide K-12 schools in developing AI policies and implementation strategies for responsible AI integration in North Dakota.

policies.title: AI Guidance for Education
policies.description: Oklahoma Department of Education guidance on understanding AI, benefits, risks, and academic integrity.
policies.summary_text: Addresses understanding AI, benefits and risks, roles and responsibilities, academic integrity considerations, and implementation guidance for Oklahoma schools.

policies.title: AI Guidance for Education
policies.description: Rhode Island guidance on AI instructional practices, equity, and college/career readiness.
policies.summary_text: Provides instructional guidance addressing equity and bias, support for diverse learners, security considerations, and preparation for college and career readiness in an AI-driven world.

policies.title: AI Standards Framework for K-12
policies.description: South Carolina AI standards framework for career and technical education including AI curriculum.
policies.summary_text: Establishes curriculum standards and course framework for teaching AI concepts in K-12 career and technical education. One of the first states to develop dedicated AI curriculum standards.

policies.title: AI Guidance for Education
policies.description: West Virginia Department of Education guidance on AI use across school roles and risk management.
policies.summary_text: Addresses AI use for users in various school roles including classroom instruction, school administration, and risk management considerations for West Virginia schools.

policies.title: Guidance for AI Use Policy in Schools
policies.description: Wyoming Department of Education guidance for school districts on developing AI use policies.
policies.summary_text: Provides guidelines for Wyoming school districts on developing AI use policies, focusing on appropriate and responsible AI use and academic integrity.

policies.title: AI Guidance and Planning Framework for Schools
policies.description: Michigan comprehensive AI guidance and planning framework for K-12 school districts.
policies.summary_text: Comprehensive AI integration framework developed by Michigan Virtual in partnership with the Michigan Department of Education. Covers eight key areas including data compliance, ethical use, plagiarism, data privacy, informed consent, and algorithmic transparency for K-12 educators.

policies.title: GenAI Guidance for K-12 Schools
policies.description: Arizona generative AI guidance providing direction for effective and responsible AI implementation in schools.
policies.summary_text: Developed by the Arizona Institute for Education and the Economy at Northern Arizona University. Provides guidance on teaching and learning with generative AI, administrator and school system use, and ethical considerations for educators.

policies.title: AI Policy Template for Local Education Agencies
policies.description: Alabama State Department of Education customizable AI policy template for school districts.
policies.summary_text: Provides a customizable AI policy template for LEAs to develop and implement AI policies. Addresses responsible AI use, data privacy, facial recognition restrictions, and compliance with federal and state laws.

policies.title: Learning with AI, Learning about AI
policies.description: California Department of Education guidance on AI integration in K-12 schools.
policies.summary_text: CDE guidance document providing a framework for understanding, using, and teaching about AI in California schools. Accompanied by an AI Resource Kit released in April 2024 with practical tools for educators.

policies.title: Colorado Roadmap for AI in K-12 Education
policies.description: Comprehensive roadmap developed by 100+ stakeholders for AI integration in Colorado schools.
policies.summary_text: Developed by the Colorado Education Initiative with over 100 stakeholders. Covers reshaping teaching and learning, advancing equitable access for all learners, and developing policy for transparent and ethical AI use. Includes a pilot program in eight school districts.

policies.title: AI Responsible Use Framework
policies.description: Connecticut Commission for Educational Technology guidance on responsible AI use in education.
policies.summary_text: 22-page guidance document detailing AI's role in the classroom, defining AI terminology for teachers, and providing a framework for responsible AI use. One of the first state-level AI education guidance documents in the nation.

policies.title: Leveraging AI in the K-12 Setting
policies.description: Georgia Department of Education comprehensive guidance for implementing AI in K-12 education.
policies.summary_text: Comprehensive framework for AI in K-12 education with strategies for students, teachers, and administrators. Features a Traffic Light system for evaluating AI tool appropriateness and an AI tool rubric assessing privacy, usability, and cost. Emphasizes data privacy, academic integrity, and AI literacy.

policies.title: AI Guidance for Educators
policies.description: Indiana Department of Education guidance document on AI use in K-12 schools.
policies.summary_text: Provides guidance to Indiana educators on responsible AI use in K-12 schools, covering classroom applications, data privacy considerations, and implementation strategies.

policies.title: Guiding Principles for AI in Education
policies.description: Minnesota Department of Education guidance on responsible AI use in K-12 education.
policies.summary_text: Outlines guiding principles for responsible AI use in education, based on the U.S. Department of Education's Office of Educational Technology report and the National Center on Education and the Economy's framework.

policies.title: AI Guidance for K-12 Classrooms
policies.description: Mississippi Department of Education guidance on appropriate AI use in schools.
policies.summary_text: Provides procedural guidance and instructional strategies to district leaders, school leaders, and classroom teachers on how to appropriately use artificial intelligence in Mississippi schools.

policies.title: Generative AI Implementation Recommendations for PK-12 Public Schools
policies.description: North Carolina DPI guidance on generative AI implementation in public schools.
policies.summary_text: Living document covering leadership and vision, human capacity, curriculum and instruction, data privacy and security, and technology infrastructure. Features the EVERY framework for responsible AI use. Fourth state education department in the nation to issue AI guidance.

policies.title: STELLAR Pathway to AI Teaching and Learning
policies.description: Nevada Department of Education ethics, principles, and guidance framework for AI in K-12 education.
policies.summary_text: Developed through the Nevada A.I. Alliance task force with stakeholder engagement. Provides ethical AI integration guidance for K-12 classrooms using the STELLAR framework for responsible AI adoption.

policies.title: AI Guidance for K-12 Education 1.0
policies.description: New Mexico Public Education Department comprehensive AI guidance for schools and districts.
policies.summary_text: Developed with the Friday Institute at NC State University. Covers AI literacy with age-appropriate strategies for K-5, 6-8, and 9-12. Features the M.A.Z.E. framework: Monitor data privacy, Assess for accuracy, Zero-in on bias, Evaluate value.

policies.title: Generative AI in K-12 Classrooms
policies.description: Oregon Department of Education guidance on generative AI use and policy development for K-12 schools.
policies.summary_text: Suite of guidance documents covering generative AI in K-12 classrooms, developing policy and protocols for AI use, and resources for educational AI use. Among the earliest state-level AI education guidance.

policies.title: AI Framework for Utah P-12 Education
policies.description: Utah State Board of Education framework for AI use in P-12 schools.
policies.summary_text: Statewide AI framework to help school districts develop AI policies and practices. Living document covering responsible AI use, data privacy, and instructional integration. Positions Utah as a national leader in K-12 AI education.

policies.title: Guidelines for AI Integration Throughout Education
policies.description: Virginia guidance on AI integration in K-12 and higher education, directed by Executive Order 30.
policies.summary_text: Developed in response to Governor Youngkin's Executive Order 30 (January 2024). Provides tools, instructional resources, and support for implementing and using AI at all levels of education in Virginia.

policies.title: Human-Centered AI Guidance for K-12 Public Schools
policies.description: Washington OSPI comprehensive guidance for ethical and responsible AI use in public schools.
policies.summary_text: Published by OSPI, making Washington the fifth state to issue state-level AI guidance. Developed by a diverse advisory group of educators, technology experts, and researchers. Now on version 3.0 with ongoing updates. Covers ethical considerations and responsible classroom use.

policies.title: A6874 - AI Literacy in the Digital Equity Competitive Grant Program
policies.description: Establishes an AI literacy grant program to expand equitable access to AI education in New York.
policies.summary_text: Establishes a competitive AI literacy grant program under the Digital Equity framework. Provides grants to public schools, community colleges, higher education institutions, and nonprofits to expand AI education, improve digital literacy, and reduce technology access disparities. Companion bill S7691 in the Senate.

policies.title: S2862 - AI Instruction in Schools
policies.description: Requires school districts to provide AI instruction and requires the Secretary of Higher Education to develop AI model curricula.
policies.summary_text: Reintroduction of S3876 from the 2024-2025 session. Requires school districts to incorporate AI instruction in grades K-12 as part of the NJ Student Learning Standards in Computer Science and Design Thinking. Requires public higher education institutions to offer AI certificate and degree programs.

policies.title: HB 114 - AI Education in Public Schools
policies.description: Requires local public school boards to promote AI education for students and encourage AI professional development for staff.
policies.summary_text: Requires local public school boards to promote artificial intelligence education for students and to encourage professional development relative to artificial intelligence for faculty and staff.

policies.title: NSF AI Education Act of 2025
policies.description: Federal bill to strengthen AI education through NSF fellowships, scholarships, and community college Centers of Excellence.
policies.summary_text: Calls on the National Science Foundation to create fellowships for students and instructors, expand AI education through scholarships, and establish regional Centers of Excellence at community colleges. Bipartisan bill co-sponsored by Representatives Salinas and Pettersen.
